page.title: 09CLAUGHTON HALL:Domestic
page.content: The Oyston family have owned Claughton Hall for 13 years.It is their family home and headquarters for the chairman and two executives with interest in Oy- stons Estate Agencies,Red Rose Radio a- nd cable T.V.The general office was Mr Morse's bedroom but now contains 6 des- ks,a computer,and filing cabinets.The Great Hall is the largest room and is used for board meetings,dinners,staff training and charity concerts.In the 1930's fifteen staff ran the house. Today there are 2 full time and 2 part time catering and homekeeping staff and one gardener.The 100 acres of land is mainly of amenity value.46 acres are grazing land for horses and sometimes rented out for sheep.There is extensive 40 to 200 year old mixed woodland.
